com.test.automation.framework.pagemodel

Class PageClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.test.automation.framework.pagemodel.PageClass

  • public abstract class PageClass
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to support Page classes for the Page Object Model implementation
    Author:
    Varun Menon

        protected void setDriver(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
        Sets the driver object for use with this page class.
        Parameters:
        driver - WebDriver object to be set for use.

      • getDriver

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getDriver()
        Returns the driver object(if set) for this Page class else return the driver object from the Browser class object.
        Returns:

      • to

        protected <T> T to(java.lang.Class<PageClass> pageClass)
        Navigates to said page after appending the base url to Page url. This utility also verifies whether the driver is at the said Page by using "at" method of the Page after navigation.
        Parameters:
        pageClass - - Page class extending PageClass to where the driver have to be navigated.
        Returns:
        The said page class object once verification is successful.

      • at

        protected <T> T at(java.lang.Class<PageClass> pageClass)
        Utility to verify that the driver is at said page or not.
        Parameters:
        pageClass - Page class extending PageClass which have to verified to be on.
        Returns:
        The said page class object once verification is successful.

      • isAt

        protected boolean isAt(java.lang.Class<PageClass> pageClass)
        Similar to at(Class) method, instead it return true or false based on the at verification done.
        Parameters:
        pageClass - Page class extending PageClass which have to verified to be on.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • toUrl

        public abstract java.lang.String toUrl()
        The url for the said page. Please implement this method in your page classes and return the respective url for the page. In case the page dont have any url just return and empty string. *

        Note:Do not append the base url to this url as it is automatically appended at runtime.

        Returns:
        - Page url without appending the base url.

      • at

        public abstract boolean at()
        Method used to verify whether the driver object is on the said page or not. Return true or false based on the criteria to identify whether driver object is on the said page or not.

        This is a very important method as it will help in making you Page object model tests robust as it will help you to validate the Page is shown before any of the util methods of the said page is executed. Note: For better results do not store your evaluated condition in a variable. Try to evaluate the success condition everytime this method gets executed.

        Returns:
        true or false based on the page verification condition.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Use this method in case you want to initialize some variables or data while creating an Object of you Page class. This method will automatically get executed whenever you use to(Class) or at(Class) utils. In case you have nothing initialize just implement an empty method.
